The following actions refer to the progress made on defining 12 protected areas and/or conservation agreements:
A) One (1) “letter of intention aimed at consolidating the agreement or declaration of conservation areas and sustainable use of the dry forest ecosystem by referendum", signed on June 16, 2015 by representatives of the community action boards of the municipalities of Aipe and Neiva which belong to the basin of the Aipe and Patá Rivers; these areas of influence of the project cover 9,107 ha and conform a landscape matrix which is essential for the conservation, restauration, rehabilitation and sustainable use and the improvement of the dry forest's ecological connectivity and functionality.
B) 30,182.5 ha identified as potential areas for protection and conservation (PAs/CAs) through the following prioritized basins:
- 7,198 ha, Cañas-Ancho River (Dibulla)
- 7,698 ha Garupal River (Valledupar)
- 6,499.5 ha, Arroyo Grande River (San Juan Nepomuceno)
- 2,770 ha, Aipe-Patá River (Aipe-Neiva)
- 3,150 ha Yaví River (Natagaima-Prado)
- 2,867 ha, Dagua River (Dagua, La Cumbre, Restrepo and Vijes).

description.narrative: Management effectiveness of two protected areas with dry forest measured through the METT score sheet based on the effectiveness analysis used at the national level.

comment.narrative:
Integrated Management District (DMI) of Atuncela: 49.02%
Land Conservation District (DCS) of Río Grande*: 0
*It will be confirmed in the project's mid-term evaluation.

Integrated Management District of Atuncela: 59.02%
Land Conservation District (DCS) of Río Grande*: 10%
*Increases by 10% according to baseline.

The project developed a prioritization exercise and agreed that it is not cost-effective to work in Ceibotes and Besotes because these two protected areas are outside of the prioritized areas of the project; therefore actions to be conducted will not benefit these two areas. Thus, the work will be done in the Land Conservation District of Río Grande, located in the basin of the Dagua River. Therefore, the following change to the indicator is proposed: Change in management effectiveness of two dry forest protected areas, measured through the METT score sheet, based on management effectiveness assessments which are used at the regional level. The goal will focus on the protected areas: The Integrated Management District of Atuncela and the Land Conservation District of Río Grande, both of the areas located in the basin of the Dagua River. Based on the above, a form was sent to CVC, regarding the two protected areas: The Integrated Management District of Atuncela and the Land Conservation District of Río Grande. Through this form, the baseline for the Atuncela DMI will be confirmed and the baseline for the Río Grande DCS will be established.

description.narrative: Area (in hectares) of rehabilitated dry forest.

comment.narrative:
The following actions have been undertaken regarding implementation of landscape management tools, to contribute to the maintenance of water flows and reduction of degradation and desertification.
A) Identification of areas of conservation value for the design and establishment of landscape management tools (HMP, in its Spanish acronym), in tropical dry forest (bs-T, in its Spanish acronyn) for the prioritized basins, three in the Caribbean region and three in the Andean region. The areas with conservation value were established not only according to indicator biological groups but based on the ecosystem service offer. 6 maps were created (one per basin), identifying areas of conservation value.
B) Design of a conservation corridor and process of socioeconomic characterization of lands with local actors of the prioritized basins in the Caribbean region.
C) Monitoring protocols for indicators of ecosystem functions (water and soil) in 6 basins prioritized for the implementation of landscape management tools.
D) Methodology for the design and conciliation procedure (negotiation) of a model for the process of participative plot planning model for the design of landscape management tools.
E) Agreements were reached with Corpoguajira and Los Colorados Flora and Fauna Sanctuary to set up plant nurseries. In this respect, a technical proposal was prepared for the production of vegetal material to set up the landscape management tools.

activity-description.narrative: Municipios priorizados en el marco de la estrategia.

description.narrative: El sector de hidrocarburos contribuye a la generación de entornos sostenibles de manera social y ambiental y sus empresas participan, conocen, implementan e inciden en normativas, programas y acciones para contribuir con este propósito.

Entidades nacionales cuentan con herramientas y capacidades para desarrollar acciones articuladas en territorio y con conocimiento de sus dinámicas y necesidades para la toma de decisiones y la gestión de la conflictividad asociada al sector.

Como parte de la preparación del PNI (2010), el país estuvo de acuerdo en acciones prioritarias a nivel nacional para cumplir con su obligación bajo la Convención de Estocolmo.Este proyecto contribuye a esta convencion

Disminuir y potencialmente minimizar la liberación de COP no intencionales y mercurio por medio de la implementación de MPA y MTD en los cuatro sectores prioritarios a través de un número de proyectos demostrativos
Apoyar a los territorios en la construcción de paz e involucrar a la ciudadanía en torno a este propósito

Capacidades ciudadanas fortalecidas para la transformación no violenta de los conflictos sociales y la construcción de paz en el marco de la implementación de la estrategia de respuesta rápida del gobierno nacional.

Desarrollar capacidades en los actores sociales y autoridades locales, para la transformación y el trámite pacifico de los conflictos sociales y ambientales que promuevan una cultura de construcción de paz y desarrollo.
